info.title: HCL Project KEEP Core API v1
info.description: REST APIs for Domino and more done right. With declarative security and access to Code, Design and data

get.summary: Get documents for Forms or Views in OData format
get.description: ODATA is JSON with defined Meta data

requestBody.description:
Document body in JSON format. Key/value pairs of fields and their values to create. Some modes may not allow any editable fields, in which case an empty JSON object should be passed.

The Key "Form" is required, and also it should have configured mode "odata" beforehand.

parameters.description: Form or view name to query

get.summary: Get an document in OData format
get.description: ODATA is JSON with defined Meta data

requestBody.description:
Document body in JSON format. Key/value pairs of fields and their values to update. Some modes may not allow any editable fields, in which case an empty JSON object should be passed.

The Key "Form" is required, and also it should have configured mode "odata" beforehand.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description:
This field records the current revision version of document. It's a 32-character hex-encoded string of date. 

If db config "requireRevisionToUpdate" is enabled, then revision is required when update document and only update document when revision version is right.

/design/nsf.summary: Create a database, based on a template if required
/design/nsf.description:
Create a database, in the meanwhile configure it known to KEEP. 

Default ACL values for the database:
- -default-, Editor
- Anonymous, No Access
- LocalDomainAdmins, Manager
- LocalDomainServers, Manager
- <Local Server Name>, Manager
- OtherDomainServers, No Access
- <Current User>, Manager

requestBody.description: Just nsfPath and title are requested. templateName is not required.

post.summary: Create a database, based on a template if required
post.description: Create a database, based on the nsfPath and title in the request body, if required you can also configure the template in request body.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Keep Database

/run/agentAsync.summary: Runs an existing agent in a given database

requestBody.description: Request body for run an agent asynchronously. agentName is required.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Keep alias for the database to be queried

post.summary: Runs an agent in a database asynchronously
post.description:
Queues an existing agent to run asynchronously, serverside. Existing limits of agent execution duration apply, but the HTTP response will be delivered immediately. The response will include a UUID for the request, which can be used to check progress or cancel the agent.

Content in the payload will be passed to the scheduler to identify run criteria.

parameters.description: Keep alias for the database to be queried

/documentmodes/{unid}.summary: Provides information of all enabled modes for the relevant document
/documentmodes/{unid}.description:
Returns a JSON object of all the modes schemas available for the Form tied to this document.

People can configure many different modes which have different fields with Read/Write/Both permission.

Successful retrieval
Response does not contain a media type since a media type of an attachment can be any type.
For a list of well defined media types check the available documentation:
https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml

get.summary: Retrieve a document's attachment

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: Name of the field in which the attachment resides. Pass this to remove the hotspot for the attachment from that rich text field, otherwise the hotspot will remain. If the attachment is attached directly to the document, not a field, there is not need to do this.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Keep alias for the database to be queried

parameters.name: attachmentName
parameters.description: Name of the attachment

parameters.name: unid
parameters.description: Universal Id of the document to be acted upon

/auth/local.description:
User might want to deploy Keep locally and interact with the ID deployed on their Notes client.
This endpoint will provide the session token. This endpoint only works on a Notes client.
It will NOT work on a Domino server

200.description: Successful authentication with the local Notes.id

get.summary: establish session with local Notes.id
get.description:
Allows for a local (Notes client) deployment to get a session based on the local Notes.id
Suitable for applications that are installed local

/document/{unid}.summary: Actions on a document at a specific mode
/document/{unid}.description:
Update access to a document will typically restrict which fields on the document can be changed.

Modes are used to define statuses for a document, and will a definition identifying which fields can be seen and changed. A patch request that includes fields outside those restrictions will throw a 400 error (bad request), specifying which fields are illegal or missing.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Keep alias for the database to be queried

parameters.name: computeWithForm
parameters.description: Should a document be computed with its form's "Default Value", "Input Translation" and "Input Validation" formulas before retrieval

get.summary: Retrieve a given document at its appropriate mode

requestBody.description: Key/value pairs of fields and their values to update. Some modes may not allow any editable fields, in which case an empty JSON object should be passed. 'Form' is required.

parameters.name: parentUnid
parameters.description: UNID of an existing document, to make this a response document

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description:
This field records the current revision version of document. It's a 32-character hex-encoded string of date. 

If db config "requireRevisionToUpdate" is enabled, then revision is required when update document and only update document when revision version is right.

put.summary: Perform an update on the document at the relevant mode

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Keep alias for the database to be queried

parameters.name: unid
parameters.description: Universal Id of the document to be acted upon

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: mode to perform the document access in. Defaults to 'default' if missing. All lowercase, no spaces, letters and numbers only

parameters.name: richTextAs
parameters.description: The format RichText fields will be returned.  The default if unspecified is html.

/lists/{name}.description: Those are list entries, not the underlying documents

parameters.name: dataSource

value.@documentset: Defined by selection formula, check in Domino Designer
value.options:
%REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare
value.initialize:
Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub
value.handleOneDoc:
%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub

/design/{designType}/{designName}.summary: Get design information for a specific design element.
/design/{designType}/{designName}.description:
Retrieve design information for a specific design element in json format.

For designType 'forms', the 'designName' you should give a value of the specfic name of the form you have configure. You can configure other designType likewise.

AgentSample.value:
fromSalesforce
            
         %REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare


Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub



%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub

Fix Body.Options:
%REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare
Fix Body.handleOneDoc:
%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub
Fix Body.Forward:
Declare Sub Initialize
Declare Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
Fix Body.Initialize:
Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub

BasicAuthRequest.description: API way to get a token

password.description: Password, not written on a Post-it

username.description: Who you are or your eMail

scope.description: Optional approved scopes. A scope is a string, the scope field a series of space separated strings. If omitted the default value "MAIL $DATA" that give access to PIM functions and any database the user has access to. Other scopes can be the name of database aliases like "demo", "crm". The values are case sensitive. Regular database scopes are lower case. Scopes can't open access, that's what ACLs do, but limit them. For a user driven login, this makes limited sense, so it is mostly to achieve JWT parameter parity, so scopes can be tested without an IdP issuing a JWT at the end of an OAuth process

QueryRequest.title: Root Type for queryrequest
QueryRequest.description: Query and constraints for a DQL query to Domino. If not passing property 'mode', it will search from mode 'dql'.

maxScanDocs.description: Specifies the maximum allowable number of documents scanned across all query terms. DQL execution returns an error when exceeded. Default is 500,000.

maxScanEntries.description: Specifies the maximum allowable number of view entries scanned across all query terms. DQL execution return an error when exceeded. Default is 200,000.

noViews.description: Specifies not to perform any view processing in satisfying a query. Default is False (off).

timeoutSecs.description: Specifies the maximum allowable seconds a DQL query is allowed to run. DQL execution returns an error when exceeded. Default is 300 (5 minutes).

viewRefresh.description: Refresh a UI view to match its associated back-end view.

mode.description: This is form mode configured in Keep Database. If no mode has been passed, it will use default "dql".

forms.description: List of form names to be added to the query. KEEP will lookup all potential alias values and add them to the query clause

400.description:
Invalid request. Shows up when submission is flaky:

- Wrong content-type
- Missing or wrong parameter types
